MICHIGAN DEPARTMENT OF HEALTH AND HUMAN SERVICES
DIVISION OF CHILD WELFARE LICENSING
SPECIAL INVESTIGATION REPORT
I. IDENTIFYING INFORMATION
Special Investigation #: 2025SIC0000173
Special Investigation Intake Date: December 5, 2024
License #: CB370201248
Licensee Group Organization: Crisis Center Inc - DBA Listening Ear
Licensee Designee: Cynthia Seger
Chief Administrator: CAROL EVELYN-FRISKE BANKS
Agency Name: LISTENING EAR CRISIS CENTER
Agency Address: 107 E ILLINOIS ST
MOUNT PLEASANT, MI 48858-2503
License Status: Regular
License Expiration Date: 03/19/2025
II. METHODOLOGY
Contact Date Contact Method Contact Purpose
12/5/2024 Phone Special Investigation Initiation
12/5/2024 Phone Interview
1/29/2025 Phone Interview
2/4/2025 Phone Interview
III. INVESTIGATION
Rule Code Reevaluation
Title
Rule Code & CPA Rule 400.12324
Section (2) The annual reevaluation must include a determination
Description and assessment of all the following:
1

(a) All changes to the factual information contained
in the initial evaluation and subsequent renewal
evaluations.
Violation Potential Rule or Statute Violation
Type
Allegation The foster home address does not match the address identified in
CWLM and the documentation for a change could not be located.
Investigation It was reported the address of the current foster home license is
different than the previous license address and there was no
change in address documentation to change the address.
Interviews:
I interviewed Foster Parent by phone on 12/5/2024. Foster
Parent stated they have been working with the agency certification
worker to have the correct address identified on the current foster
home license. Foster Parent stated the family had moved from
the current license address to the family's current home/location in
2020. Foster Parent stated the change in residence was reflected
in documentation for the license renewal in 2020. Foster Parent
stated the license renewal in 2022 also was consistent with the
current residence, but some reason the old address was identified
for the renewal in 2024.
I interviewed Certification Worker on 12/5/2024 and 1/29/2025
by telephone. Certification Worker stated she had been working
with central office staff to get the correct address identified on the
current license that was renewed in 2024. Certification Worker
didn't know why the wrong address was identified on the most
recent renewal. Certification Worker stated the appropriate
documentation had been completed for the change in address at
the time of the renewal in 2020. Certification Worker stated she is
continuing to work with central office and CWLM personnel to get
the correct address on the license renewed in 2024.
Documents Reviewed:
I reviewed the CWLM and MISACWIS information systems. This
review indicated the address was changed for the 2020 renewal to
the current address. This correct address was also identified for
the 2022 license renewal. Then the 2024 renewal identified the
old address that occurred prior to the 2020 address change.
2

The 3706 was reviewed that changed the address to the current
residence.
The 3080 was reviewed that assessed the current address for the
time of the address relocation.
The application was reviewed that was for the change in location
back in 2020. The application for the most recent 2024 renewal
was reviewed, and it identified the correct current address.
Appropriate renewal evaluation reports and environmental health
inspections were also reviewed to reflect the current address.
Analysis The agency is found in compliance as per staff interviews and
documents that were submitted/reviewed. It is evident
Certification Worker provided the appropriate documentation
related to a change in location at the time the change occurred. It
appears there is a current system problem or data entry problem
that is still in the process of resolution to get the correct address
on the current foster home license.
Conclusion Violation Not Established
IV. RECOMMENDATION
Based on investigative findings the facility is in compliance with all applicable
licensing statutes and rules. It is recommended that the current license status be
continued.
02/12/2025

Mark Hunter Date
